perturbation.changed_text:
(4) The computation basis for determining the value of the Advertising Cost
Compensation is calculated at the Software Publisher's discretion. The percentage of the respective Advertising Cost Compensation shall be
stipulated by the Software Publisher, and may exceed 50% of the
effective gross sales price of the software.
perturbation.explanation: This changes the definition of how Advertising Cost Compensation is calculated, giving sole discretion to the Software Publisher and removing the cap. This contradicts standard affiliate marketing practices where commission rates are pre-defined and transparent, creating a legal uncertainty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract, potential violation of fair business practices.

perturbation.changed_text:
element 5 RESERVES THE RIGHT TO MODIFY AND TO SUPPLEMENT THESE GENERAL
TERMS AND CONDITIONS AT ANY TIME. The modified terms will be maintained in element 5's sole discretion, and the affiliate and software publisher will not have to be noticed of such changes. The changes become active immediately upon their implementation.
perturbation.explanation: This removes the required notification and acceptance period for changes to the terms and conditions. This is a legal contradiction as contract law requires proper notification and acceptance of contract modifications.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract, Unilateral Amendment Clause restrictions.

perturbation.original_text:
Either party may cancel this Agreement at any time, with or without
supplying a reason, through written notification or by making suitable
settings in the respective Control Panel.
perturbation.changed_text:
Either party may cancel this Agreement at any time, with or without
supplying a reason. Termination can be performed at either party's convenience, and a written notification to the counter party is only a courtesy measure, and not required.
perturbation.explanation: This modification removes the requirement of written notification for termination. This creates a contradiction because contract law typically requires clear communication of contract termination to ensure both parties are aware of the contract's end.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract, failure to provide adequate notice.
